Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation?
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

II. METHODOLOGY

Residential Treatment Plan, Behavior Management Philosophy
and procedures, and Dress Code.

ALLEGATION:
Staff member told youth to remove their hat. Youth removed the hat and walked to
their room. Staff member followed youth and continued to engage in a verbal
altercation which escalated to a physical altercation. Staff member grabbed youth's
wrist and pushed youth. Youth punched staff in the face.
INVESTIGATION:
CMO Probation Officer was interviewed via telephone, on 12/16/2021. She
reported obtaining the Incident Report a “couple of weeks ago”. After speaking to
Youth A, she began to believe there was a “bias in the Incident Report”. She
reported Youth A said the Incident Report was not correct in the description of the
incident. She also reported Youth A believed Staff 1 has anger issues and might hit
him.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 12/16/21. He
reported speaking to the staff involved and provided technical assistance. He moved
Staff 1 to another house, so he has no contact with Youth A while the investigation is
pending. He reported the two staff involved will be “written up” because they partially
closed the door during the incident, which he reported is against practice. He stated
the agency does not have a policy about closing a youth’s door. He reported
speaking to the youth who became involved in the situation and informing them that
their actions were inappropriate. He also reported having no personnel issues with
the staff other than the current write-up for closing the door.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 12/16/21. Youth A
reported he went to his bedroom because he was upset after being told he had to
remove his hat, only to be followed by Staff 1 and Staff 2 who confronted him after
he picked up a fork and both staff attempted to take the fork from him. He became
aggressive with staff and hit Staff 1 several times in the head area before falling to
the ground when staff attempted to restrain him which was consistent with the
incident report. Youth A additionally reported Staff 1 came into his room and “stood a
few inches away” from him. Staff 1 stood with his hands clinched into fists at his side
while standing in front of him. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed his hand while Youth
A grabbed a fork with the other hand. He was mad but not to the point of losing
control. He pushed Staff 1 and said he wanted to be left alone. Staff 1 then pushed
him and they ended up “tussling”. He described the tussling as “wrestling while
standing”. He didn’t know Staff 1 was trying to put him in a restraint and stated,
“maybe there was a misunderstanding”. He punched Staff 1 three times because he
didn’t know what he would do if he got him to the ground. He reported being pushed
down and laying on his back when Staff 2 came into the room and told Staff 1 to get
off him. While lying on the ground he began to hit the bottom of his desk. He
reported Youth B and Youth C helped him up when Staff 1 left the room. He also
reported getting mad, grabbing a sharp object, and going after Staff 1 when he was
stopped by Youth B and Youth C. He stated, “I was not thinking that far ahead and
what I was going to do to Staff 1. I’m not sure if I would have stuck him or not.”
Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 12/16/21. He reported
remembering the incident and trying to help Youth A calm down. Youth A was very
upset, and he gave him cups of water to help him calm down. He reported not
knowing about the sharp object Youth A reported to have had and never witnessing
staff being inappropriate during the incident. He described Staff 1 as a caring staff
with a big heart and is his favorite staff. He described staff as being laid back and
caring for the youth in the program. He reported feeling safe and well taken care of
in the program.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 12/16/21. He reported
remembering the incident and observing Youth A being aggressive when Staff 2 was
trying to keep him from coming out of his room. He reported blocking Youth A to

keep him from being more aggressive. He reported never observing Youth A on the
ground and stated, “I know what he is capable of when he gets aggressive”. Youth C
reported feeling safe in the program and getting along will all of the staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 12/16/21. She reported
Staff 1 and Staff 2 enter Youth A’s bedroom because of his history of self-harm and
Youth A having a fork. This resulted in Youth A hitting Staff 1 several times, staff
attempting to restrain Youth A and Youth A and Staff 2 falling to the floor which was
consistent with the incident report. She additionally reported Staff 1 waved for her to
assist him when he was in the doorway of Youth A’s room and told her Youth A was
about to do something. She reported upon entering the area she observed Youth A
saying Staff 1 was trying to tell him what to do and he no longer wanted to be in the
program. She also reported Youth A had a plastic fork in his hand and both staff
stood close to him because of his history. She reported Youth A has a history of self-
harm and they wanted to be close enough to stop him if he engaged in self-harming
behaviors. Youth A lunged towards them and pushed Staff 1, saying “I will do you
like I did my dad”. She reported he pushed Staff 1 again and as they backed up, he
tried to push past them to get out of the room. Youth A hit Staff 1 several times and
as they began the restraint by securing his arms, everyone fell to the ground as he
Youth A resisted and pushed them off. She reported when they got up Youth A
grabbed a sharp plastic object and tried to get at Staff 1 with it. She told Staff 1 to
leave the house to keep him from being the target of Youth A’s anger. She reported
Youth B and Youth C blocked Youth A and pushed him back into his room. She
described Youth A as having a love-hate relationship with Staff 1 and Youth A tends
to get emotionally out of control often.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone, on 12/17/21. He began the interview
stating he made “a mistake by going into his room to try to talk to him”. He reported,
“I pushed the door partially shut because I was trying to reduce any attention he
might get from others”. He reported Youth A attempted to “jab” himself with the fork
and Staff 1 grabbed Youth A to keep him from self-harming. Staff 1 reported trying to
deescalate Youth A but finding Youth A not being willing to listen to him. He also
reported Youth A was very upset and anxious over an upcoming home pass. He
reported Youth A dropped his weight and went to the floor during the time he was
attempting to get the fork from him. Youth A was trying to hit his head on the corner
of the desk while on the ground. Staff 2 was attempting to help get the fork from
Youth A while also trying to keep him from hitting his head on the desk. Staff 1
reported telling the other youth who helped keep Youth A in his room to go to their
rooms as did Staff 2. Youth A stated, “I’m going to do you like I did my dad.” He
reported getting out of the room and leaving Staff 2 with Youth A as he believed
Youth A was targeting him. He thought this would help Youth A calm down. Staff 1
reported speaking to the Chief Administrator about the “two mistakes” he made. He
closed the door and not stopping the other youth who became engaged on their own
to keep Youth A in his bedroom. He reported a safety plan was developed and
involves Staff 1 not working in the same house as Youth A.

Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/4/2021 of the main area outside of Youth A’s bedroom was
reviewed on 1/5/2022. Because of the location of the camera and the incident taking
place in Youth A’s bedroom, there is no clear view of the incident taking place in the
room. At one point, Staff 2 can be seen on the ground with Youth A, and it appears
that she is attempting to obtain something from him. After Staff 1 exits the room, two
youth go into the room. Several minutes later the youth leave the room and Youth A
is observed attempting to charge out of the room towards Staff 1. One of the other
youth stands in his way and pushes him back into the room.
Documents Reviewed:
 Human Resources information on Staff 1. There was no disciplinary action
documented in the HR file for Staff 1. He received his orientation training on
8/11/21, Behavior Management techniques training on 10/23/21, and
Emergency Holds training on 9/16/21.
 Incident report #127500183 dated 12/4/21. This document describes the
incident with Youth A becoming upset over a directive given by Staff 1 and
going to his room. Once in his room Youth A picked up a fork which caused
Staff 1 to engage him to keep him from self-harm. This resulted in a physical
confrontation between Staff 1 and Youth A with Youth A pushing Staff 1 and
then punching him multiple times. During the attempt to remove the fork from
Youth A, Youth A fell to the ground. Once back up, Staff 1 left the room and
Youth A picked up a sharp piece of plastic. Youth A went after Staff 1. This
document indicates Staff 2 was able to redirect Youth A.
 Three other incident reports were reviewed that involved Youth A engaging in
self-harming behaviors. Two of the incidents involved him striking his head
against the floor and the third involved Youth A attempting to cut his throat
with a piece of glass from a window he broke.
 Updated Residential Treatment Plan dated 10/11/21 and covering a period of
7/14/21 to 10/11/21. This document has treatment goals that address the
presenting problems for Youth A and the “Emotional Stability” goals identified
inconsistent progress.
 Behavior Management Philosophy and Procedures. There is no date on this
document. This document indicates staff can perform a physical intervention
when there is a clear risk of imminent harm to self.
 Dress Code dated 972006. This document states “no hats ore bandannas are
to be worn in the house. Wave caps are allowed at appropriate times”.

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance as they attempted to restrain
Youth A after he had a fork in his hand and assaulted staff.
There is no evidence to support that staff grabbed Youth A and
pushed.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It was recommended the agency develop an updated policy to
reflect staff not being alone in a bedroom with youth and if
necessary, not shutting the door. It was recommended the
agency updated policy to reflect if youth attempt to become
engaged in physically intervention with other youth during an
incident how staff are to respond.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
The facility was not uploading the required incident reports into the MiSACWIS
system as required.
INVESTIGATION:
Documents Reviewed:
The following documents were provided by the facility but not found in the
MiSACWIS system.
Incident report dated 8/23/21. This document describes the incident with Youth A.
This document indicates Youth A went AWOL off the campus but returned in a very
short time.
Incident report dated 8/26/21. This document describes the incident with Youth A
attempting to hang himself with his bedsheet while in his room. This document
states, “Youth A went to his room and began to hang his sheet on his bunk bed. He
attempted to wrap it around his neck, but staff intervened and grabbed the sheet”.
Incident report dated 9/24/21. This document describes the incident with Youth A.
Youth A “smashed his window, picked up a couple of pieces of glass and started to

cut both sides of his face”. This action resulted in Youth A being taken to the
emergency room for the “multiple cuts to his face on both sides and a severe cut to

APPLICABLE RULE
Residential Critical Incidents
Foster Care
Abuse Neglect
Contract 2.10. I
1) The Contractor must document any incidents required by
Michigan Administrative Code, R 400.4150 and MDHHS
policies in MiSACWIS, including, but not limited to:
b) Attempted suicide.
c) Serious injury or illness requiring inpatient
hospitalization.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance of the requirements for
documenting incidents into the MiSACWIS system.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
III. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to
the license status of this child caring institution.
